perturbation.original_text: All subsequent monthly payments of Base Consulting Fee shall be paid within the first five days of the following calendar month.
perturbation.changed_text: All subsequent monthly payments of Base Consulting Fee shall be paid within the last five days of the current calendar month.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a direct contradiction regarding the timing of monthly payments. The original text states payments are due within the first five days of the *following* month, whereas the modified text states payments are due within the last five days of the *current* month. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding when payment is actually required, which could lead to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: The Consultant's bonus payment level will be set at a minimum of 25% of the annual gross Base Consulting Fee.
perturbation.changed_text: The Consultant's bonus payment level may be set at the discretion of the board from 0% to 25% of the annual gross Base Consulting Fee.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction in the guarantee of a minimum bonus. The original contract explicitly sets a minimum of 25%, while the modified clause introduces a discretionary range from 0% to 25%, effectively removing the guaranteed minimum and creating uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: The Company may terminate Consultant's engagement at any time by giving Consultant 60 days prior written Notice of the termination. In such case, 100% of the Consultant's unvested stock and, if applicable, option or warrant compensation of any nature will vest without any further action required on the part of the Consultant or the Company and the Company will deliver to the order of the Consultant promptly upon receipt of a written demand of the Consultant such shares of common stock or options at its sole expense as become due to Consultant hereunder. The Consultant's right to receive compensation whether in cash or securities shall survive any termination of this Agreement Without Cause.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company may terminate Consultant's engagement at any time by giving Consultant 60 days prior written Notice of the termination. In such case, 50% of the Consultant's unvested stock and, if applicable, option or warrant compensation of any nature will vest without any further action required on the part of the Consultant or the Company and the Company will deliver to the order of the Consultant promptly upon receipt of a written demand of the Consultant such shares of common stock or options at its sole expense as become due to Consultant hereunder. The Consultant's right to receive compensation whether in cash or securities shall survive any termination of this Agreement Without Cause.
perturbation.explanation: The original text guarantees that 100% of unvested stock will vest upon termination without cause, while the changed text lowers that amount to 50%. This is a direct conflict that makes the enforceable amount unclear.
perturbation.location: ARTICLE 4 TERMINATION, Section 4.1 Termination of Engagement (a)(ii)
